quizzes.question: In reference to an object, color, height, weight and name are all examples of:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]JavaScript Objects[/h1]

JavaScript variables are containers for data values. [b]Objects [/b]are variables too, but they can contain many values.

Think of an object as a list of values that are written as [b]name:value[/b] pairs, with the names and the values separated by colons.
[b]Example:[/b][code format="js" ]var person = {
 name: "John", age: 31, 
 favColor: "green", height: 183
};[/code]
These values are called [b]properties[/b].
[img id="2765" width="100%"]
[note]JavaScript objects are containers for [b]named values[/b].[/note]

quizzes.question: What built-in property is used to count the number of characters in an object's property?
Access the "color" property of the "hair" object using dot syntax.
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Object Methods[/h1]

An object [b]method [/b]is a property that contains a [b]function definition[/b].

Use the following syntax to access an object method.[code format="js" ]objectName.methodName()[/code]
As you already know, [b]document.write()[/b] outputs data. The [b]write()[/b] function is actually a method of the [b]document[/b] object. [code format="js" codeId="688"]document.write("This is some text");[/code]
[note]Methods are functions that are stored as object properties.[/note]
